reviews:
Great coffee and fresh baked goods.
Talking with Sarah made my day!
What's not to love?
I had a great tea here. Very pleasant.
My Flat white was superb.  It‚Äôs a tiny spot with very limited seating but it is clean and friendly and the food/coffee is great.  Def. worth a visit
Best coffee and lemonade and chai lattes! Bud's still has delicious beverages. They no longer have indoor dining
Like the sidewalk ordering window. The Americano was good as well
Love coffee n service but line blocks sidewalk. Only a problem when I'm not in line!
Amazing breakfast sandwiches !
Small shop (squeezed between two restaurants) but good coffee and nice seating area.
Great cortado, accepts reusable cups - or  enjoy non-disposable on the sidewalk patio.

Nice line up of wholebeans by Quietly and Hatch on display to purchase. Great option for specialty coffee around the area. Surpringly very few to choose from other than the big names. So, glad to have you existing for the neighborhood!üëçüëç
Absolutely LOVED their coffee! It‚Äôs a quaint coffee place, with great service and by far one of the best coffees I‚Äôve had in Downtown! ‚ô•Ô∏è
Great coffee, friendly staff and a solid assortment of baked goods including vegan options
Super flat white, juice and cakes. Good service and location. Perfect pitstop for The Beaches.
My #1 spot for coffee and snacks in the beaches. Gone countless times and was never disappointed! I also love the window service so that I can go when I‚Äôm walking my dog.
Great coffee and pastries/breakfast. No indoor seating but some outdoor seating.
A huge local favourite, great coffee,
The drip coffee was gross. Tasted like luke warm salt water. I ended up throwing it out.

Expensive coffee ..I got a cortado and I was expecting the nice strong and soft taste characteristic of a good cortado; instead I got a bitter coffee. It might be the kind of coffee they use?? The long line outside of the store is kin if deceiving. Maybe other coffee in the menu taste better.
I got Vanilla Latte‚òïÔ∏è and a lemonade üçã both so tasty. The coffee had a great smell as well!
I am working next door finishing off a new Indian restaurant to open up in the area and I was lucky enough to work right beside buds so I grab my coffee in the morning in the afternoon

Friendly environment and staff. Poppyseed lemon muffin was perfection; balance of thirty lemon with just enough of a subtle sweetness in the icing, was amazing! Their roast beef sandwich was very tasty as well.
Definitely our favourite coffee shop!
Awesome little spot for coffee and great baking.  Keep walking past the Timmy's and Starbucks and spend your money at this great local spot!
Great lattes!
Great spot! Coffee is great and the vegan banana walnut muffin is divine. I‚Äôm not vegan but get it always. It‚Äôs so moist, I hate a dry cakey muffin.
Best coffee in the city! And amazing maple oat scones!
Perfect for a quick cup of coffee along queen st.
Great drip coffee and citrus iced tea

LOVE! Such a gem to have right in the middle of The Beach neighbourhood.  The espresso is delicious and they know how to make their drinks. They carry minor figures oat milk which I think is the best in lattes and coffees. And their baked goods are unreal!  Staff is also just so wonderful!
Excellent coffee

We were in the area for a holiday for a few days, and finding a good coffee shop was important! We are so glad we tried Bud's coffee because the coffee was fantastic!
We had a coffee there every morning, and each coffee was consistently good! Their iced coffee was also exactly how I like it, and not overly sweetened like Starbucks!
If you're ever in the area, this is definitely the best place to get coffee!

This is "the local" coffee shop and during COVID, they've made a coffee take-out window pretty charming. Whether you're getting a coffee or a pastry, service is fast and friendly. Perfect excuse to take your drink on a walk to the beach down the street.
Thanks Natalie!!üëç

Cute walk up coffee spot in the Beaches. The downside is there‚Äôs no patio or seating area so it‚Äôs a grab and go spot. I tried the drinks so can‚Äôt speak to the food/snacks.

They charge extra for iced drinks which doesn‚Äôt seem necessary as it‚Äôs the same drink with a few iced cubes.
Good coffee and cookies!
Great little place! Both the oatmilk cappuccino and the drip coffee were excellent. They have some GF options for food as well.
Great service. Lemonade and Iced Tea are very flavorful.
Great coffee and pastries very friendly staff will definitely be going back.
I've been going to Bud's for just over a year now and they never fail on quality. If you're an oat milk drinker, they use Minor Figures which is the best. Try the GF caramel brownie!
Awesome muffins!
Great coffee.  Nice people. Good prices.
Best coffee and service in the City hands down!
Great little place. Staff are friendly and whatever you buy is really good. My favorites are hot chocolate and gluten free  brownies.
If you‚Äôre a fan of chai lattes, this is your place to go! My mum loves the way they‚Äôre made and I couldn‚Äôt agree more. Their baked goods are also to die for on a early morning on route to work.
Pretty damn good coffee.
Once you start their coffee you get addicted to it.
The capuchino was cold and the scone was just ok. Expensive for the quality they deliver
Great local little caf√©.

So grateful this place exists in the Beaches.  Its definitely top 5 of the best tasting coffee and espresso in Toronto. Their Oat Lattes are divine.  Staff is also super friendly which really helps in making you want to go back!  And their baked goods are delicious.
Setup well for storefront purchases right now. Delicious coffee and food.
Cute spot, great quality coffee, and lovely people
Great place, great lattes!
The staff at Bud's are incredibly warm and accommodating! Thank you so much
Ordered a cappuccino, unfriendly service by the young man who gave me my coffee, VERY acidic coffee . Will not go back
The BEST coffee spot in the neighborhood. Lovely staff and excellent coffee options. I not only buy coffee but also beans from them - great that they have Quietly Coffee and Hatch beans.
Ask for the spider milk latte (üï∑Ô∏èüêÑ‚òï) secret menu item! ‚Ä¶
I really enjoy going there in the morning to grab my first cup of coffee of the day
Winners. I could go on. Godzillas of coffee culture. Try their cauliflower sandwiches.
Retail espresso beans are great!! Friendly service, too!! ‚òïüíï ‚Ä¶
One of my favourite coffee spots in the beaches
Best americanos and lattes! Plus oat milk!!
Thanks for the review. Glad you liked it.
If you were going to put a coffee shop in the beach...this would be it... quaint, great pour-overs, mellow staff...and yummies
Great little spot. For a fantastic cup of coffee! Staff super pleasant and speedy!
The best !!
Always a great cup of coffee! Cute little place with friendly staff.
Very, very good coffee at a reasonable price.   Quaint, friendly place.  If you are on Queen East, I recommend stooping for a cup or a tea.
Friendly service, great coffee
Hello Logan thanks for the great review.
Simply fantastic coffee and scones done right.
Thanks for the great review
Excellent Americano!
Kid friendly, great staff and a good cup of coffee. There's a play section to the back of the cafe with a chalk board and some toys.
Well done folks. Took an awkward space and made it comfortable and inviting to everyone. Carefully made drinks - high quality experience.
Good Americano coffee. Breakfast sandwich and Nanaimo bar was pretty good too.
Local and friendly. Gotta love it and support it.
The coffee is really delicious, what would be nice is if they could offer a unsweetened nondairy milk option for people who have dietary restrictions
Great coffee. Good treats!
Great cappuccino. Nice owner. Good to support locally owned.
Great coffee
The place looks ok but their coffee and customer service needs some serious work. Specially if they charge that much for the coffee.
Great cappuccino! Friendly service. Intimate ambience where you can engage in conversation with anyone. I love it!
Coffee was good. I recommend this place!
Lovely little spot to grab a great cup of coffee or espresso beverage. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would visit again!
Great coffee
Good coffee, friendly staff.
Great cold summer drinks and amazing coffee
In terms of food, I haven't tried everything, but I can say I LOVE this spot. great atmosphere, cool spot!

Clean and nice coffee shop. I wish having better beans, but they do very nice with what they have. Very clean washrooms, I appreciate it. A bit dissapointed not having my v60 few minutes before closing.
Great coffee, great food, great staff!

Very lively, local caf√©. WiFi can be picked up from Nando's next door if unavailable. They're a little overwhelmed in the am if it's too busy. Maybe I experienced some staff training? But overall great spot, that I like to frequent.
Well made coffee, nice spot, clean bathrooms. Glad we stopped in here for a cappuccino! Cheers
Institution!
Great New Zealand flavour.Oyr famous flat white made,just the way it should be !!!
Love this place! We enjoyed the scones and great coffee many mornings here. The staff and owner were incredibly kind and we enjoyed sitting by the front garage and people-watching.
Great staff, good coffee. Only go to independent coffee places
Friendly service. Good java. Nice vibe
Great coffee shop in the beaches. Probably my first choice when in the area.

Great little quiet getaway on the far side of Queen East. A welcoming vibe that also includes a children's section at the back of the coffee shop. Pastries run out almost entirely by end of day as this is a popular place for the treats. I'd come here again for a treat and tasty cup of tea.
Very strong coffee, I had the special with blackberries and chocolate and it was good. A little small and slim seating, it‚Äôs a busy place for sure.

This is the perfect quintessential neighbourhood espresso and coffee shop.  When I bring friends to The Beach and/or Toronto, I always bring them here. It speaks for itself.  Bud‚Äôs provides superb quality drinks in a relaxed and inviting neighbourhood atmosphere. Ken, Sarah, Rose, Kyle and Ryan and rest of the gang all produce excellent espresso.  Whenever I travel outside of Toronto and have espresso at other far flung locales, I realize some of the best espresso simply comes from my own neighbourhood in the Beach. The shop emulates everything that is so wonderful and soulful about this neighbourhood. Just simple good wholesome espresso. No gimmicks here.
Best coffee in the Beaches! The staff are knowledgeable and friendly. Plus they always play great music and are wonderful with kids.
Cozy
Nice to have an independent coffee shop in the beaches
Good indie vibe, very good coffee.
Great coffee...cozy spot
Unquestionably THE best cuppa in the city.  Great staff.  Beautiful pour.
Oatmilk flat white! Great location in the Beach!
Best cappuccino I've had, bar none!
Funky coffee shop with the best almond milk lattes around.Toys for kids

This is a real gem in the heart of the beaches. Bud's is a super chill spot to grab tea or coffee. They also have amazing artisan pasteries (ie. Poptarts). They have been open several seasons but are now in a new location slightly more east on Queen St. (closer to Lion On The Beach) BONUS *** this new location is bigger and has allowed them to set up more tables and a cute play space for kids under three

Very rude!, was a daily customer. Showed up christmas eve for my daily latte at 730 , no holiday hours posted. The young man working inside saw me standing there and we made eye contact 3 times over 15 minutes. Finally i knocked on the door to ask the hours and he came out and told me 8 oclock. You would think if you saw a customer standing out front that you would take 30 seconds out of your day to let them know when they can come in.

i will not return

Jim,
I apologize for the late notice in getting back to you.  I am sincerely sorry for everything that happened on that morning.  There is no excuse for any of it.  I would like to offer you a $20 gift card to make up for the inconvenience and the way you were treated.  Please let me know if you would accept this and I will leave it for you with our staff. Again, I am deeply sorry.
Best,
Sarah
The best coffee joint in the Beaches. Grab a seat and listen to the local hustle and bustle!
Super friendly service coupled with the best coffee on Toronto!  (imo). can't loose !!
Great coffee, tasty treats, nice employees.
Check out the giraffes.
Great coffee
Good coffee in the beach area
Fabulous espresso based drinks, good desserts and a friendly staff all in a bright atmosphere. It makes for a great local coffee hangout. We will definitely come back next time we are in the Beaches.
Awesome coffee and super friendly staff.
Latte was a bit on the warm side vs. hot so I will know for next time to ask for extra hot - other than that coffee and the service was good the food looked delish
Best in the area
Slow and expensive. A very milky capucino with no foam for nearly $5. Typical pretentious Beaches coffeehouse
Outstanding
Best spot in the Beach

Hey, if you're looking to pay almost $5 for an incredibly watery americano, this is the place to go.  I mean...you can't charge customers almost $5 and have it completely watered down!  There are so many other coffee shops in the city that are better.
Great place to chill with a cup of coffee. Oh, and the Nutella croissant is to die for!
The only coffee worth drinking in the beaches. They use Cut Coffee (Sam James) and do it right. Nice place to set up shop with a laptop while you enjoy your coffee.
Always great coffee and service
Best coffee in the Beach, no question.
Best coffee shop in the beach.
Best in the beach!
One of the best coffees I‚Äôve had in a while. Ordered a Late and flat white
Great place, the ice latte was magnificent. I‚Äôve never seen it done in the way they did it. ( definitely recommend, and will be back shortly !)

Good lattes and cappuccinos

Sandwiches and breakfast sandwhich was are good but  overpriced for what you get.
Good little coffee hole on the Beaches. Great non-coffee options too. There is not a ton of seating.

Mixed reviews. Lattes are good.
Cafe au lait not so much. They used brewed coffee (would have preferred a shot of espresso or a stronger brewed coffee) with steamed milk and charged the same price as a latte - what a disappointment.
Super place. These guys know their stuff about coffee. Music and ambience is spot on tooüëåüè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åø ‚Ä¶
Cozy, friendly spot. Great coffee & wonderful staff. My first stop in the morning.

Really good pour overs, super friendly staff and fresh baked goods. Really close to the beach so you can always tale it to go and enjoy a nice walk. The setting is really nice and everyone that comes in is super nice.

I feel like the Beaches are purposely keeping Bud's under wraps and not letting anyone know about this spot. I had no idea about Bud's and was dreading of finding a good cup in a new spot. With the overwhelming positives for this spot, I stepped into their door and was happy to Sam James beans being used.

Recently, it sounds like they moved to a bigger spot and still making a great cup. It is still very busy... even on a lazy Saturday afternoon, there was no tables freed up and the constant line up was in and out of the place. It has a great friendly vibe and everyone here is quite warm with each other. It's clear that Bud's has made themselves part of the community because of the number of personal conversations between patrons or the staff and patrons. This was really nice to see. I guess Toronto can be friendly after all!

I have to appreciate how they use the good Canadian brands like Pluck and Cut Coffee to create their drinks. Nothing like supporting a good local. I think the baristas really know their drinks cause the flat whites we got were surpassing some of the well known coffee shops that sit on Toronto top 50.

Flat White with almond milk - The butter knife beans are just so good and Bud's did them right. This was a rich and robust coffee flavour with a touch of milkiness from the microfoamed milk. No acidity to make me wince. We decided to do the cashew and almond milk side by side taste test. I personally liked the almond milk more. I found it didn't influence the flat white as much and let the coffee flavour be more forward. I liked this one. 4/5

Flat White with cashew milk - I found the cashew milk version to have less of a coffee flavour... it definitely changed the taste. I would say it was a milkier flavour but more muted for sure. I did find cashew milk to be creamier than the almond milk but also weirdly enough, I touch more sweet? So if you're looking for the texture the most closest to cow's milk, this would probably be your favourite alternative milk. Kudos to Buds for offering more than one type of nut milk. 4/5

If I'm far out east again, I'll definitely make Bud my choice to get a good flat white and happy I'm not stuck to Starbucks.
Fantastic espresso
Exceptional coffee, beans taste like Black Canary Coffee. Service is decent, supports tap.
Great little neigbourhood gem. Great coffee, friendly staff. Nice place. Tired of the chains, this is it.
Love the new buds.
Tastes are OK.
Amazing coffee... great staff! I LOVE this place!
The place is quaint and bright! Coffee is delicious! Only thing was, the price for a flat white extra shot with coco milk was very high ($6.75) compared to Remarkable Bean or Hailed coffee or Te Aro.
The Best! A true neighbourhood gem. Such friendly people and a great product. What else could you ask for. So happy there back open in their new location a block east of the old one on Queen.

Bud's is a true neighbourhood coffee shop, not a chain. Their customer service is great and the coffee is delicious. I thought they were closed for good, but just noticed that they are just moving to a new spot further east on Queen.
Great coffee and muffins. Friendly staff!
No fuss, laid back and genuinely nice people plus great coffee. Happy to have found Bud's on our short stay in Beaches.
Good service and excellent coffee :)
The coffee is on point. The service is no-nonsense. You should go.
Best coffee in Toronto - no one pulls a shot like Bud's.

Great staff, great coffee, great view of Queen E and only let down by the super small space and lack of variety in the pastry department
(some more food options would be great!)
Good service and excellent coffee. What more can you ask for from a coffee shop?
My local java-shop! Love hanging out, people watching in the sunny space with great coffee and the snacks are pretty amazing too!
While the coffee is THE BEST, the Chai Wala Tea is heaven! The staff are so sweet and service is great! I love the coziness of the shop and the art work is fantastic!
The owners are so nice and everyone who works there is cute and makes sick brews
Best coffee in the beaches
Classic, independent coffee shop in the beaches, go see them.
Great little coffee shop fine brews here
The best local shop, great beans.
Friendly servers.  No barista attitude here!  Bare bones, unpretentious and decent beans.
Excellent espresso. My go to place in the Beaches hood.
They even added foam art to the hot chocolate.   I didn't want to add a lid because it was so artfully prepared.
Superb service and superb coffee.
coffee
Bud's makes a great Americano. Everyone is really nice too!
Great coffee.. Cool little cafe
